instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915 convert to uma
threads.message: I read somewhere it is possible to convert these board to UMA but after pram reset all is lost. I have 2 for my own use and I would like to do it. Somebody have the info how to do it?

threads.title: 820-2915 convert to uma
threads.message: Yes it can be found with Google. These is a simple script you can run from "single user mode" I believe. Google is your friend here.

threads.title: 820-2915 convert to uma
threads.message: This is what I dont understand. If it has gpu problems and OS X is not load, how can I run single user mode.

threads.title: 820-2915 convert to uma
threads.message: Hold down Command+S when turning on. You will be booting  into a command line only.

threads.title: 820-2915 convert to uma
threads.message: Ok, thats ok. But script I have is only under Ubuntu. Is there for os x?

threads.title: 820-2915 convert to uma
threads.message: No idea, this is not something that I have ever messed with or ever will. It is a hack that is not very good really. High Sierra also introduces a no backlight bug from sleep. Just replace the GPU and do a proper fix.
